intro: Aceratium braithwaitei, commonly known as the Braithwaite's aceratium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the Canary Islands, specifically Tenerife, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often at higher elevations. It has a compact growth habit with a rosette of basal leaves and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional uses. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
